topics.body:
"@toxicrystal":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55419909636872730fff0800#post_55419909636872730fff0800
Basically imagine if a video game studio took all the money nowadays put into quick time events and instead dumped it into the enemies' ai.  The only ways to win the game on the hard mode is either constantly pressing quick save or getting good.

S.T.A.L.K.E.R. is to fps games what Dark Souls is to action rpg games.


Who loves the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. franchise?
Masochists
Who hates the franchise?
xXxsm0kewEedeveryday420mLgxXx

I'll admit the games have a lot of hilarious bugs, like whenever a npc holds a shotgun like a pistol, but for what it is (a hardcore fps game) it's really good.


Tl:dr; easy mode in S.T.A.L.K.E.R. = hard mode in most AAA fps games.

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55419c56636872041e170300#post_55419c56636872041e170300
[bq="Shadow the Hedgehog"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55419b01636872730f610c00#post_55419b01636872730f610c00
STALKER is just a post-apocaliptic fps open world game[/bq]
Yeah, but it does what almost every other post-apocalyptic fps open world game fails to do: make you feel like you could die at any second.

"Shit; I just need to get through"
*runs past bandits to run into doorway*
*sees bandit with shotgun pointed at your face*
"Oh shi-"
*kerblam!*

If you take a machinegun to the face in the game you're going to die; if you take a rocket to the face you're definitely going to die.  You have no power armor in the game; you have no shields in the game; you don't have regenerating health and if you try scumming it in a alleyway waiting for troops to come in they're going to throw a grenade where you're hiding.
